', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2020-03-26 09:13:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'WIP [trainbackport] Prevent nftables to interfere with tripleo firewall

', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2020-03-26 11:46:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "WIP [trainbackport] Prevent nftables to interfere with tripleo firewall

If for some reason (we've hit this via
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1694723) /etc/nftables/*
rules get populated and the nftables service is started and enabled
(which it is by puppet)
we'll effectively end up having two separate firewalls: the iptables one
managed by puppet and the nftables one left in the hands of the rpm
defaults.

We need to make sure that nftables is not set up, since that will
effectively interfere with the puppet-firewall/tripleo-ansible firewall
modules.

To do so we empty /etc/sysconfig/nftables.conf (that way if this
code runs before the nftables rpm is installed it won't be
overwritten), then if the nftables.conf files has changed we flush
the nft rulesets and immediately reload the iptables services

Closes-Bug: #1869166

Change-Id: Ia4a2a58aada3b893fa23e04722f0a7d77e05a981

Thursday 26 March 2020  14:55:02 +0000 (0:00:00.480)       0:01:47.052 *

Thursday 26 March 2020  14:55:02 +0000 (0:00:00.130)       0:01:47.183 *
skipping: [undercloud-0] => (item=iptables.service)

commit_message:
[train/backport] Prevent nftables to interfere with tripleo firewall

If for some reason (we've hit this via
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1694723) /etc/nftables/*
rules get populated and the nftables service is started and enabled
(which it is by puppet)
we'll effectively end up having two separate firewalls: the iptables one
managed by puppet and the nftables one left in the hands of the rpm
defaults.

We need to make sure that nftables is not set up, since that will
effectively interfere with the puppet-firewall/tripleo-ansible firewall
modules.

To do so we empty /etc/sysconfig/nftables.conf (that way if this
code runs before the nftables rpm is installed it won't be
overwritten), then if the nftables.conf files has changed we flush
the nft rulesets and immediately reload the iptables services

Tested by deploying UC and OC on both rhel 8.1 and rhel8.2 and
then redeploying the UC and confirming that the nftables flush+
iptables service reload is not triggered on redeploy:
TASK [Prevent Nftables to set up any rules] ****************************
Thursday 26 March 2020  14:55:01 +0000 (0:00:00.127)       0:01:46.572 *
ok: [undercloud-0]

TASK [Flush Nftables rules when nftables.conf changed] *****************
Thursday 26 March 2020  14:55:02 +0000 (0:00:00.480)       0:01:47.052 *
skipping: [undercloud-0]

TASK [Restart iptables to restore firewall after flushing nftables] ****
Thursday 26 March 2020  14:55:02 +0000 (0:00:00.130)       0:01:47.183 *
skipping: [undercloud-0] => (item=iptables.service)
skipping: [undercloud-0] => (item=ip6tables.service)

NB: The cherry pick from master is not clean due to the tripleo-firewall
    moving from puppet to ansible in master

Closes-Bug: #1869166
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/715173
Change-Id: Ia4a2a58aada3b893fa23e04722f0a7d77e05a981

commit_message:
Take Lifecycle Controller out of recovery mode

This patch is to check if a node is in recovery mode and take it
out of recovery mode by setting LifecycleControllerState attribute
value to 'Enabled'.

Modified list_lifecycle_settings() method to use
utils.list_settings() for retrieving lifecycle settings.

Change-Id: I4287f317b2413b70cd00fd4cf8aa69bff6ae5e2f
(cherry picked from commit ceef78a938dca4f06d14bcfdac1a6d2e53e48ded)

subject: Tolerate NFS exports in /var/lib/nova when selinux relabelling
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 17216, 'name': 'Martin Schuppert', 'email': 'mschuppert@redhat.com', 'username': 'mcschupp'}, {'_account_id': 20733, 'name': 'Rajesh Tailor', 'email': 'ratailor@redhat.com', 'username': 'rajesht'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23811, 'name': 'Oliver Walsh', 'email': 'owalsh@redhat.com', 'username': 'owalsh'}, {'_account_id': 28211, 'name': 'Shyam Biradar', 'email': 'shyam.biradar@trilio.io', 'username': 'shyam-biradar'}, {'_account_id': 28223, 'name': 'Cedric Jeanneret', 'display_name': 'cjeanner (Tengu)', 'email': 'cjeanner@redhat.com', 'username': 'cjeanner'}, {'_account_id': 30133, 'name': 'Piotr Kopec', 'email': 'pkopec17@gmail.com', 'username': 'pkopec'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-25 17:57:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Tolerate NFS exports in /var/lib/nova when selinux relabelling

When the :z bind mount option is used, podman peforms a recursive relabel of
the mount point which is failing with "Operation not supported" if there are
any NFS exports mounted within. While it's possible for NFS to support true
selinux labelling, in practice is rarely does.

As we are already walking the tree to set ownership/permission, take ownership
of the relabelling logic too and skip relabelling on subtrees where we hit this
error.

Change-Id: Id5503ed274bd5dc0c5365cc994de7e5cdcbc2fb6
Closes-bug: #1869020

commit_message:
Tolerate NFS exports in /var/lib/nova when selinux relabelling

When the :z bind mount option is used, podman peforms a recursive relabel of
the mount point which is failing with "Operation not supported" if there are
any NFS exports mounted within. While it's possible for NFS to support true
selinux labelling, in practice is rarely does.

As we are already walking the tree to set ownership/permission, take ownership
of the relabelling logic too and skip relabelling on subtrees where we hit this
error.

Change-Id: Id5503ed274bd5dc0c5365cc994de7e5cdcbc2fb6
Closes-bug: #1869020

commit_message:
Set memcache_servers for heat::cache automatically

This patch makes puppet-tripleo set memcache_servers parameter in
heat::cache according to available memcache servers in deployment,
so that operators can easily enable caching feature.

Note that this patch doesn't enable caching. To actually enable
caching, the heat::cache::eanbled parameter in puppet-heat should be
set.

Change-Id: Ieb53f2ac4cd6381f2a450bce6aaff22790c2a404

commit_message:
Take Lifecycle Controller out of recovery mode

This patch is to check if a node is in recovery mode and take it
out of recovery mode by setting LifecycleControllerState attribute
value to 'Enabled'.

Modified list_lifecycle_settings() method to use
utils.list_settings() for retrieving lifecycle settings.

Change-Id: I4287f317b2413b70cd00fd4cf8aa69bff6ae5e2f
(cherry picked from commit ceef78a938dca4f06d14bcfdac1a6d2e53e48ded)

commit_message:
Use tempest_tempestconf_profile_extras for tempest image

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/714601 sets the images path in
tempestconf using profile. It sets the cirros image path to
vexxhost images when periodic is set to true.

It also avoids the duplication of setting cirros image as a
featureset overrides.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/714909/

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/714601
Change-Id: I3112a33a4e1e8ba22f3568b1ff2534c7a39e8afa
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

subject: RBD: fix volume reference handling in clone logic
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 5314, 'name': 'Brian Rosmaita', 'email': 'rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-rosmaita'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 12369, 'name': 'Pure Storage CI', 'username': 'purestorage-cinder-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 18883, 'name': 'IBM Storage CI', 'email': 'IBM_CI@il.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibm_storage_ci'}, {'_account_id': 22248, 'name': 'HPE STORAGE CI', 'email': 'hp.cinder.blr.ci@groups.ext.hpe.com', 'username': 'hp-storage-blr-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22510, 'name': 'Synology DSM CI', 'email': 'cinder@synology.com', 'username': 'synocinder', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23613, 'name': 'NEC Cinder CI', 'email': 'nec-cinder-ci@istorage.jp.nec.com', 'username': 'nec-cinder-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24921, 'name': 'Hedvig CI', 'email': 'openstack@hedviginc.com', 'username': 'hedvig_ci'}, {'_account_id': 25243, 'name': 'NetApp CI', 'username': 'NetApp-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26077, 'name': 'NetApp SolidFire CI', 'email': 'ng-openstack-solidfire-ci@netapp.com', 'username': 'netapp-solidfire-ci'}, {'_account_id': 26537, 'name': 'Cloudbase Cinder SMB3 CI', 'email': 'cinder-smb3-ci@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'cinder_smb3_ci'}, {'_account_id': 28706, 'name': 'Boxiang Zhu', 'email': 'zhu.boxiang@99cloud.net', 'username': 'ZhuBoxiang'}, {'_account_id': 28801, 'name': 'Cisco Cinder CI', 'email': 'cisco-cinder-ci@cisco.com', 'username': 'cisco-cinder-ci'}, {'_account_id': 29716, 'name': 'LINBIT LINSTOR CI', 'email': 'linbit_ci@linbit.com', 'username': 'LINBIT_LINSTOR_CI'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-27 23:35:17.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/rbd.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/test_rbd.py'], 'message': 'RBD: fix volume reference handling in clone logic

This patch fixes a bug in volume cloning where the source volume is
prematurely closed.  If the destination volume requires flattening and
an exception occurs during flattening, the code attempts to perform
cleanup operations on an already closed volume.  This resulted in a
segmentation fault which causes cinder to restart.

Co-authored-by: Jon Bernard <jobernar@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ib713aa91b775d8ec07ffdb24dfe1db1b6ecf2921
Closes-Bug: #1794956
(cherry picked from commit 394fbd7e20dbd8fb8cc58510657753432c43fa9b)
(cherry picked from commit 7bfd3c4dcf528ba900d6179ff06c227ea1016176)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
RBD: fix volume reference handling in clone logic

This patch fixes a bug in volume cloning where the source volume is
prematurely closed.  If the destination volume requires flattening and
an exception occurs during flattening, the code attempts to perform
cleanup operations on an already closed volume.  This resulted in a
segmentation fault which causes cinder to restart.

Co-authored-by: Jon Bernard <jobernar@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ib713aa91b775d8ec07ffdb24dfe1db1b6ecf2921
Closes-Bug: #1794956
(cherry picked from commit 394fbd7e20dbd8fb8cc58510657753432c43fa9b)
(cherry picked from commit 7bfd3c4dcf528ba900d6179ff06c227ea1016176)

commit_message:
Add flexible reservation usage enforcement spec

This spec proposes a new mechanism to allow operators to define custom
policies that determine whether a given user request to create or update
a lease is valid. A chain of enforcement filters will be called on every
lease request. Two filters will initially be defined: one that checks
that leases do not exceed a length threshold, and one that delegates to
an external HTTP service. Future filter implementations may be included
with Blazar, but there is also a mechanism for operators to provide
their own filter implementations as Python modules.

Change-Id: I376d348a334a09614545b1cadafb3cc76cfa1b1c

revisions:

py2 but had some issue on setup.cfg metadata to restrict
the installation on <py3 env.
- https://github.com/mtreinish/stestr/issues/292

This is fixed and released in 3.0.1

Let's cap the stestr version for py2 and py3 env
also adding 3.0.0 in blacklist.

", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix on stestr requirements for non-py2

stestr 3.0.0 is released with drop the support of
py2 but had some issue on setup.cfg metadata to restrict
the installation on <py3 env.
- https://github.com/mtreinish/stestr/issues/292

This is fixed and released in 3.0.1

Let's cap the stestr version for py2 and py3 env
also adding 3.0.0 in blacklist.

Change-Id: Id0c2371c9ba37a3f19c2e0a3c121f99b54ac9ce8

commit_message:
Add xstatic-** projects for vitrage-dashboard

Current vitrage-dashboard repo has multiple embedded js copies. However
these embeded js copies are not allowed by Horizon's official
contributor guide.
This change aimes to make these js copies to xstatic packages which can
be installed by pip and remove all of embedded js copies from
vitrage-dashboard repo.

Change-Id: I92fef30261a4c17523682fe9c9b3483a759cf500
Needed-By: Ic5506ed6831454b222984f859f829de3cdd6f95c

commit_message:
Wrap IPv6 address with brackets

If IPv6 address is not wrapped with brackets OpenFlow rules are
not properly installed.

This change was backported from OVN Octavia provider:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/708818/.

Change-Id: Ib5836b004fd47671c4cdaa382c9376380beee448
Closes-Bug: #1863892

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I4a8fb6bf9f989e9cea29a560fbd7b0a986bee4eb

commit_message:
Subcribe trunk & subport events to set subport id

Introduce a callback function in trunk plugin to receive after_create
and after_delete events for the trunk and subport resources This
function will set the subport device_id to trunk_id to prevent nova and
neutron from reusing it.

Closes-Bug: #1700428
Co-Authored-By: Nate Johnston <nate.johnston@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I97fe59752f9ef2cbe0376cd6ee0739660f5937ad

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

Now that we don't need to support py27 we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module instead of the third party mock lib.

Change-Id: I1dfdb05ddf78cd8243f31956ccf8173b2059ad33
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2020-01-10 15:51:59.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/dell_emc/xtremio.py'], 'message': 'WIP: XtremIO: send no cache for get stats requests

Trying to figure out why the stats are not getting updated on the
cinderlib tests when we do:

- get stats
- create volume
- get stats

The only thing that comes to mind is that the backend is caching the
requests, or that there is no actual request going on.

Change-Id: I5f894967d908da4ff13d7a866cb690f0405b0b6d
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
WIP: XtremIO: send no cache for get stats requests

Trying to figure out why the stats are not getting updated on the
cinderlib tests when we do:

- get stats
- create volume
- get stats

The only thing that comes to mind is that the backend is caching the
requests, or that there is no actual request going on.

Change-Id: I5f894967d908da4ff13d7a866cb690f0405b0b6d

commit_message:
Add accepted egress direct flow

Do not flood the packets to bridge, since we have the
bridge port list, we can add a simple direct flow to
the right port only.

Conflicts:
    neutron/agent/linux/openvswitch_firewall/firewall.py
    neutron/conf/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovs_conf.py

Closes-Bug: #1732067
Related-Bug: #1841622
Change-Id: I14fefe289a19b718b247bf0740ca9bc47f8903f4
(cherry picked from commit efa8dd08957b5b6b1a05f0ed412ff00462a9f216)

commit_message:
[NetApp] cDOT to set valid QoS during migration

NetApp cDOT driver is now fixed to remove the QoS Policy on the
backend volume when a share is migrated from an extra-spec which had
QoS defined to another extra-spec which has no QoS defined in it.

Change-Id: I57c2e15fc22eb2bf69ebee25a92ba10746505e73
Closes-Bug: #1706137

Update hacking for Python3

The repo is Python 3 now, so update hacking to version 3.0 which
supports Python 3.

Blacklist:
W504 line break after binary operator
W503 line break before binary operator

Fix other problems found

commit_message:
Fixed wrap from taking negative values

Now for wrap input it will take only postive integers as an input and
if any negative numbers are give it will give output as "Wrap argument
should be a positive integer".

Change-Id: I7e3b571f4ddfaa0b4b27ff343089b13cb59f7aa2
Depends-On: Ic7de4d64af51ef546f0f826cf38d1184c1afe73c

commit_message:
Update hacking for Python3

The repo is Python 3 now, so update hacking to version 3.0 which
supports Python 3.

Update local hacking check for new flake8 version.

Blacklist:
W504 line break after binary operator

Fix:
E741 ambiguous variable name
E117 over-indented
E305 expected 2 blank lines after class or function definition, found 1
F841 local variable 'e' is assigned to but never used
W605 invalid escape sequence '\.'

Change-Id: I99d574ca6569f1f177d2c5ce1011f269f4343619

subject: Add default value for user_role_file when cloning git repos
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-26 12:26:42.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/get-ansible-role-requirements.yml'], 'message': 'Add default value for user_role_file when cloning git repos

This change allows scripts/get-ansible-role-requirements.yml playbook
to be used as a standalone tool for cloning all OSA repos
referenced in ansible-role-requirements.yml into a user defined workspace.
This is useful for automatically bootstrapping a development environment
with all of the OSA ansible roles cloned outside /etc/ansible/roles.

Example:

ansible-playbook scripts/get-ansible-role-requirements.yml -e role_path_default=/path/to/workspace

Change-Id: I207853206435f0ec5faca95c69c25230e0c6b50c
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add default value for user_role_file when cloning git repos

This change allows scripts/get-ansible-role-requirements.yml playbook
to be used as a standalone tool for cloning all OSA repos
referenced in ansible-role-requirements.yml into a user defined workspace.
This is useful for automatically bootstrapping a development environment
with all of the OSA ansible roles cloned outside /etc/ansible/roles.

Example:

ansible-playbook scripts/get-ansible-role-requirements.yml -e role_path_default=/path/to/workspace

Change-Id: I207853206435f0ec5faca95c69c25230e0c6b50c

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-30 09:30:59.000000000', 'files': ['vitrage/storage/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Bugfix: Overcome mysql failure during Vitrage init.

Test the connection to detect mysql failures before executing statements.
It is better to fail early because at that point we have retries.

Backported from train

Change-Id: I14a2fb643d04cad2f6ef3ab7a80b7e7c63224f74
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Bugfix: Overcome mysql failure during Vitrage init.

Test the connection to detect mysql failures before executing statements.
It is better to fail early because at that point we have retries.

Backported from train

Change-Id: I14a2fb643d04cad2f6ef3ab7a80b7e7c63224f74

revisions:

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add filters to help process inventory for tripleo-upgrade

The tripleo-upgrade playbooks require a group to host mapping and a
list of roles. It currently makes assumptions about the inventory
structure which is fragile. This adds filters to generate the
required data regardless of the structure.

Change-Id: I0d409613d752e6f07b4641cab2967ac32e5a66d1

subject: Do not race with locks for the sync/wrapper script
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-27 18:36:51.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo-systemd-wrapper/templates/service_sync.j2', 'tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo-systemd-wrapper/templates/service_wrapper.j2'], 'message': 'Do not race with locks for the sync/wrapper script

Exit immediately and omit locking itself, when the jobs file is empty
or missing. Additionally, limit the time given for the sync trigger and
the service wrapper scripts, when acquiring a lock. Then fail it, if
the lock cannot be acquired after a 10 seconds. This prevents other
possible racy scenarios, like dealocks.

Change-Id: I19ac0c3b43c50be00350fa500ccc2a5fb1ab545c
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 39fe0ab5b935eb6c6262ed8f2a1fd0fb6e456c10)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Do not race with locks for the sync/wrapper script

Exit immediately and omit locking itself, when the jobs file is empty
or missing. Additionally, limit the time given for the sync trigger and
the service wrapper scripts, when acquiring a lock. Then fail it, if
the lock cannot be acquired after a 10 seconds. This prevents other
possible racy scenarios, like dealocks.

Change-Id: I19ac0c3b43c50be00350fa500ccc2a5fb1ab545c
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 39fe0ab5b935eb6c6262ed8f2a1fd0fb6e456c10)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-26 13:01:12.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo-container-manage/tasks/podman/create.yml', 'tripleo_ansible/tests/plugins/filter/test_helpers.py', 'tripleo_ansible/ansible_plugins/filter/helpers.py'], 'message': "Fix get_failed_containers() to correctly fetch container_data

To avoid this error:
The error was: KeyError: 'container_data'

We need to fetch container_data from async_result_item in the async
results; that's where the key is. Updating unit tests as well, and the
task which creates the facts so there is no confusion in the logs.

Change-Id: I2a5533335151c4b292e85aea310adfdc44ab1e02
(cherry picked from commit d6204498d7e9478a0ab36ef1b97acd2afeaf6d19)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix get_failed_containers() to correctly fetch container_data

To avoid this error:
The error was: KeyError: 'container_data'

We need to fetch container_data from async_result_item in the async
results; that's where the key is. Updating unit tests as well, and the
task which creates the facts so there is no confusion in the logs.

Change-Id: I2a5533335151c4b292e85aea310adfdc44ab1e02
(cherry picked from commit d6204498d7e9478a0ab36ef1b97acd2afeaf6d19)

commit_message:
Add support for encrypting backend HAProxy traffic

This patch introduces an optional backend encryption that can be added
to openstack services. This patch will also transition services to use
uwsgi when possible to handle http and https requests for API servers.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/710879/

Change-Id: I00e35b443327365c3ec1065b69c68d44c8660abe
Partially-Implements: blueprint add-ssl-internal-network

commit_message:
Support for PowerMax Volume Config

PowerMax config options have changed since newton.
Updating them to the latest for both iSCSI and FC drivers.
https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/latest/configuration/block-storage/drivers/dell-emc-powermax-driver.html

Change-Id: I574968e8e479d82c0369809bf3a8c3069c40a71b

Now user can wrap the output by adding the argument '--wrap=<value>'.

commit_message:
Adding `--wrap` functionality to Magnum Client

Now user can wrap the output by adding the argument '--wrap=<value>'.
This is implemented for all show commands in magnumclient, they are
`magnum cluster-show <id>`, `magnum cluster-template-show <id>` and
`magnum quotas-show`

Change-Id: Ic7de4d64af51ef546f0f826cf38d1184c1afe73c
Closes-Bug: #1710587

commit_message:
Redundancy-module-of-VNFFG

This specification describes changes needed to support optional module t
o construct one more VNFFG by selecting redundancy VNFFG module.

Co-authored-By: Hosung Baek <sungbogo28@gmail.com>
Blueprint:Redundancy-module-of-VNFFG

commit_message:
delete bash_completion in subcommand

There are two "completion" in the subcommand table: bash-completion
and bash_completion. but "bash_completion" is useless, so delete
it and extra code.
Closes-Bug: #1670123

Change-Id: If7a654102fc05be893bc789be0543fd2cd9634bb

commit_message:
Fix paging link protocol when behind haproxy

When using the designate public endpoint through haproxy, designate
is returning a paging link with the incorrect protocol.  This change
is to make sure designate configurs oslo_middleware to parse the
X-Forwarded-Proto header set by haproxy.

Change-Id: Ia3288ccfc655a2814c36204a5cb381d3aa57e53e
Closes-Bug: #1713663

commit_message:
use include_tasks instead of include

include is marked as deprecated since ansible 2.4[0]

Switch to include_tasks or import_playbook as necessary

[0] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/2.4/include_module.html#deprecated

Change-Id: Iff06f10c34d7d9729841d925010c5d3015dbc91a

subject: Add new default roles in os-hypervisors policies
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-30 15:58:11.000000000', 'files': ['nova/policies/hypervisors.py', 'nova/tests/unit/test_policy.py', 'nova/tests/unit/fake_policy.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/hypervisors.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_hypervisors.py', 'nova/tests/unit/policies/test_hypervisors.py'], 'message': 'Add new default roles in os-hypervisors policies

This adds new defaults roles in os-hypervisors API policies.
This policy is default to SYSTEM_READER role.

Policy rules are made more granular to adopt the new defaults.

Also add tests to simulates the future where we drop the deprecation
fall back in the policy by overriding the rules with a version where
there are no deprecated rule options. Operators can do the same by
adding overrides in their policy files that match the default but
stop the rule deprecation fallback from happening.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I2757498e0271f9b4bd90ee6bbaa444dc914e84c5
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add new default roles in os-hypervisors policies

This adds new defaults roles in os-hypervisors API policies.
This policy is default to SYSTEM_READER role.

Policy rules are made more granular to adopt the new defaults.

Also add tests to simulates the future where we drop the deprecation
fall back in the policy by overriding the rules with a version where
there are no deprecated rule options. Operators can do the same by
adding overrides in their policy files that match the default but
stop the rule deprecation fallback from happening.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I2757498e0271f9b4bd90ee6bbaa444dc914e84c5

commit_message:
Respect SSL devstack configuration

If devstack is spawned with SSL, that means we need
to configure OVN databases connectors to use TLS.

Bump hacking to 3.0.0

The new version enables a lot of standard flake8 checks, so a few
fixes are required. W503 is disabled as it conflicts with W504
and the latter seems to be preferred nowadays.

commit_message:
Check LCStatus instead of MessageID to determine if an iDRAC is ready

We are currently checking the MessageID to determine if an iDRAC
is ready. This patch is to check the value of LCStatus instead of
MessageID. If the value of LCStatus is "0", then the iDRAC is
considered ready.

Change-Id: I3426c226c4bb3cdcc95b98e9b203f100bb6777d5
(cherry picked from commit bcce3bdc6b33c8d6f0721eac024ebff61de1e2db)

commit_message:
Check LCStatus instead of MessageID to determine if an iDRAC is ready

We are currently checking the MessageID to determine if an iDRAC
is ready. This patch is to check the value of LCStatus instead of
MessageID. If the value of LCStatus is "0", then the iDRAC is
considered ready.

Change-Id: I3426c226c4bb3cdcc95b98e9b203f100bb6777d5

Adds centos-8 testing to install-deps

Removes harcoded override which prevented the detection of the
platform from working.

commit_message:
Remove tempest_tempest_conf_overrides from featureset 52

As described in related bug these values are dropped when the
same is defined via featureset override on the job. We should
drop them from the featureset to avoid confusion. They will
be set as defaults in tempestconf

Change-Id: I5aec865389be13ec2a42a1cbc72b9e7e30a4805f
Related-Bug: 1868938

commit_message:
Introduce CephAnsibleLimit

Allow the existing ceph_ansible_limit variable in tripleo-ansible
to be overridden through TripleO Heat Templates. This is useful
for speeding up stack updates to scale compute nodes.

Change-Id: I506ec233793615f94389056c56274ce53e04361f

commit_message:
Expect python3 client package in CentOS8

In CentOS, we expect to have python3 client package in 8.x while we
expect to have python2 in 7.x .
Fix unit tests to expect the correct version according to os major
version.

Change-Id: Ifdc8e09197f15720d585598b54ba9427f436dc3a

commit_message:
Cleanup hieradata for unused services in undercloud.

We currently don't support congress and tacker in TripleO, so we can
remove the hieradata for these services.
Also, we don't expect to have Barbican, Horizon, Manila and Sahara
in undercloud, so can remove hieradata for these services from
undercloud hieradata.

Change-Id: I3ec65ad41d6b37bd0f01ac62d4158248556c84af

commit_message:
Ensure no attempt to deleted sg rules owned by Octavia happens

When updating the LB security group with only the rules applied
on a Network Policy we are also considering the sg rules owned by
octavia, this result on failure when trying to delete the rules
as this operation is not allowed.

This commit ensures only the rules owned by the correct tenant
are deleted.

Change-Id: I06ece3fd93d1408f6023d3daf0ba152fe7dfe4e4
Closes-bug: 1869063

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
 - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
 - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Change-Id: I070cedee068f87a8d466d38d34abcad552ecd015
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Introduce scope_types in os-instance-usage-audit-log

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
 - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
 - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Appropriate scope_type for nova case:
- https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type for os-instance-usage-audit-log API policies
as 'system'.

Also adds the test case with scope_type enabled and verify we
pass and fail the policy check with expected context.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I070cedee068f87a8d466d38d34abcad552ecd015

commit_message:
Fix pre-commit execution

- assures pre-commit *fully* runs on CI
- fixes broken newlines caused by incomplete CI execution
- bumps ansible-lint to newer version that can finally auto-detect
  playbooks and roles
- moves ansible-lint config in official location to allow it to loaded
  regardless how is called
- cleans tox.ini and normalize indentation of multi-line options
- avoid installing non linting requirements for linter environment
- runs doc8 as a pre-commit hook and updates it config so developer can
  even run it directly. tox.ini is no longer the right place to keep
  tool configs, being replaced by multi-purpose setup.cfg which also
  avoids cluttering root with config items from each tool.

Change-Id: Ib99c8f3ad5f49ebe797de1509c042627cbff29a0
Bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1852213

commit_message:
Replace python-charm-jobs to py3 job

python-charm-jobs is py2.7 template which needs
to be replaced by py3. Replacing that with
py35 job and they can move to most recent py3
version once they are ready.

Change-Id: I5269fe2a0f6c5d3a2310b4ade41050e15848615f

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 782, 'name': 'John Garbutt', 'email': 'john@johngarbutt.com', 'username': 'johngarbutt'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9708, 'name': 'Balazs Gibizer', 'display_name': 'gibi', 'email': 'gibizer@gmail.com', 'username': 'gibi'}, {'_account_id': 14384, 'name': 'Quobyte CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci-external@quobyte.com', 'username': 'quobyteci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15941, 'name': 'DellEMC PowerFlex CI', 'email': 'emc.scaleio.ci@emc.com', 'username': 'emc-scaleio-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23498, 'name': 'IBM zVM CI', 'email': 'zvmosci@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'zvmosci'}, {'_account_id': 26515, 'name': 'Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'nova_hyperv_ci@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'nova_hyperv_ci'}, {'_account_id': 29963, 'name': 'Intel_Zuul', 'display_name': 'Intel Corporation CI', 'email': 'intel-openstack-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'Intel_Zuul'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-25 21:54:22.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/policies/test_instance_usage_audit_log.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_instance_usage_audit_log.py'], 'message': 'Add test coverage of existing instance usage log policies

Current tests do not have good test coverage of existing policies.
Either tests for policies do not exist or if they exist then they
do not cover the actual negative and positive testing.

For Example, if any policy with default rule as admin only then
test should verify:
- policy check pass with context having admin or server owner
- policy check fail with context having non-admin and not server owner

As discussed in policy-defaults-refresh, to change the policies
with new default roles and scope_type, we need to have the enough
testing coverage of existing policy behavior.

When we will add the scope_type in policies or new default roles,
then these test coverage will be extended to adopt the new changes
and also make sure we do not break the existing behavior.

This commit covers the testing coverage of existing instance usage audit
log policies.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I4a8b935829edb1d7fd7efb0291d71d3a9d2b7abd
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add test coverage of existing instance usage log policies

Current tests do not have good test coverage of existing policies.
Either tests for policies do not exist or if they exist then they
do not cover the actual negative and positive testing.

For Example, if any policy with default rule as admin only then
test should verify:
- policy check pass with context having admin or server owner
- policy check fail with context having non-admin and not server owner

As discussed in policy-defaults-refresh, to change the policies
with new default roles and scope_type, we need to have the enough
testing coverage of existing policy behavior.

When we will add the scope_type in policies or new default roles,
then these test coverage will be extended to adopt the new changes
and also make sure we do not break the existing behavior.

This commit covers the testing coverage of existing instance usage audit
log policies.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I4a8b935829edb1d7fd7efb0291d71d3a9d2b7abd

commit_message:
Add a placement audit command

There are different situations when allocations can be orphaned.
Adding a new nova-manage command to lookup at all resource providers
and check against the related compute nodes whether they have
orphaned allocations.

Change-Id: I537ed74503d208957f0a97af3ab754a6750dac20
Closes-Bug: #1793569

commit_message:
POC: Option to avoid rsync and stream logs instead

This approach should address the concerns regarding rsync being too
slow in some cases and timing out. This newer approach creates a tar
archive which is streamed with minimal compression.

The archive is never stored on disk, so it avoid failures caused by
low-disk space on remote host.

Change-Id: Ibaae2c89ff499f07167dfcb1a1eeefa80542d72b
Related-Bug: #1862612

commit_message:
add more dns forwarding options to freeipa

The default will be to use auto_forward
use_auto_forward: true

By default no-forwarders is disabled
use_no_forwarder: false

By default if use_auto_forward is false
the following dns servers will be used
as forwarding server destinations.
dns_forwarder_address:
    - 1.1.1.1
    - 1.0.0.1

Users can overr the dns servers
used as the forwarding address.

commit_message:
Add config for cinder mounting needs

This patch adds a config option 'mount_point_base' by which we can
provide the mount point for *fs volumes.
The different types of FS drivers will have separate directory for
mounting their volumes,
Eg: <mount_point_base>/nfs, <mount_point_base>/xyzfs etc.
The default mount point for *fs volumes is /var/lib/glance/mnt/*fs.

Closes-Bug: #1866966

Change-Id: I10b5ea4943ad9388ce1962eae9204b905c8ff24a

[{'created': '2020-03-24 11:01:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Use image flag in tempestconf profile

In order to use different cirros images in tempestconf, tempestconf
profile has 'image' flag which can be used to set different cirros
images otherwise it will download the images from cirros website
which might not be accessible some times.

Adding the same will help to overcome the issue.

Change-Id: Ib1e78a6ce2085df82d2a22db6817e800432f2f05
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2020-03-25 11:00:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Added tempest_tempestconf_image var for tempestconf image

In order to use different cirros images in tempestconf, tempestconf
profile has 'image' flag which can be used to set different cirros
images otherwise it will download the images from cirros website
which might not be accessible some times.

Since tempest_images vars contains multiple images but
tempestconf image profile var requires images url so introducing
new var tempest_tempestconf_image will fix the issue.

", 'number': 5}, {'created': '2020-03-26 11:35:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Added tempest_tempestconf_profile_extras var

This var is designed to extend basic tempest_tempestconf_profile
dictionary when required. Also, since profile overrides have pretty
different format (require keys to inlcude dot [1]), it was removed and
deployers can use new var tempest_tempestconf_profile_extras
to add required overrides or other options instead of fully repeating
all basic elements that are present in tempest_tempestconf_profile.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/python-tempestconf/latest/user/profile.html

Related-Bug: #1868938

commit_message:
Added tempest_tempestconf_profile_ specific vars

Added tempest_tempestconf_profile_extras and
tempest_tempestconf_profile_overrides variables

tempest_tempestconf_profile_extras is designed to extend basic
tempest_tempestconf_profile dictionary when required. New var has
presedence in case of having same keys defined. It can be used
to define image or other extra params without need of overriding
defult things

tempest_tempestconf_profile_overrides var is a replacement for
tempest_tempest_conf_overrides which was used in inapropriate way
as tempestconf profile overrides have pretty different format from what
is used by config_template.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/python-tempestconf/latest/user/profile.html

Related-Bug: #1868938

Change-Id: Ib1e78a6ce2085df82d2a22db6817e800432f2f05
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Co-authored-by: Dmitriy Rabotyagov (noonedeadpunk) <noonedeadpunk@ya.ru>

commit_message:
Add always tags for hieradata render in external upgrade.

When executing the external-upgrade command, if some of the
external_upgrade_tasks make use of the all_nodes vars (*_short_node_names
for example) then the command fails as these variables weren't
rendered. This only happens when we run the external-upgrade command
passing --tags, as the facts tags are being skipped.

This patch adds the always tags into those tasks which miss it for
external_upgrade_steps_playbook.yaml.

Change-Id: I0913df554b75d25215d5ae6547b939ad0356df3c

commit_message:
Refactored tox jobs

- assure we test triple-jobs-gerrit.py file
- fix division by zero bug with above file
- simplified tox.ini file
- prevent accidental regression on CI by checking number of passed tests
- removed test_molecule.py file which was the precursor of what later
  become pytest-molecule

Change-Id: Id6ffb9df88a376bcd3c8a0d77b2d378fca8da115

subject: DVR: only output packets from gateway directly to VMs
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-24 17:35:39.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_dvr_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/openflow/native/test_br_int.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/openflow/native/br_int.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/test_ovs_neutron_agent.py'], 'message': "DVR: only output packets from gateway directly to VMs

With DVR and the iptables_hybrid firewall driver, all packets from
tunnels are output direcly to VM ports and don't hit the NORMAL flow.
This means the mac addtesses of remote ports are not learned and so
packets in the oppsite direction are always flooded. This patch changes
the transient table so only packets from the gateway are output to VMs.
Other packets will hit the lower prority NORMAL flow. This restores the
behaviour to what it was before https://review.opendev.org/#/c/472691/

Closes-bug: #1866445
Change-Id: I812e1aeb2490cc5b0fd4b3f3f924fd771ba27bfa
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
DVR: only output packets from gateway directly to VMs

With DVR and the iptables_hybrid firewall driver, all packets from
tunnels are output direcly to VM ports and don't hit the NORMAL flow.
This means the mac addtesses of remote ports are not learned and so
packets in the oppsite direction are always flooded. This patch changes
the transient table so only packets from the gateway are output to VMs.
Other packets will hit the lower prority NORMAL flow. This restores the
behaviour to what it was before https://review.opendev.org/#/c/472691/

Closes-bug: #1866445
Change-Id: I812e1aeb2490cc5b0fd4b3f3f924fd771ba27bfa

In HA deployments, puppet-mysql is not in charge of deleting
all default users in the DB, so we end up keeping an extra
root@<controller-x> user that is never used nor supported for

Change-Id: I0dbe6bd43ad0e6bcb884798912d195e94738c344
Closes-Bug: #1867165
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
HA: drop spurious mysql user on stack deploy

In HA deployments, puppet-mysql is not in charge of deleting
all default users in the DB, so we end up keeping an extra
root@<controller-x> user that is never used nor supported for
password update. Make sure we delete it at creation time.

Change-Id: I0dbe6bd43ad0e6bcb884798912d195e94738c344
Closes-Bug: #1867165

build-containers: optimize log collection

This should avoid unnecessary copy operations for the sole purpose of
log collection by telling rsync to create hardlinks.

commit_message:
Make all mysql root users managed during stack creation/update

In non-HA deployments (undercloud and standalone) puppet-mysql
handles password for user 'root@localhost' [1], but it doesn't
try to update 'root@%'.
Instantiate the appropriate resource to fix the management of
that mysql user.

Closes-Bug: #1867186

[1] https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-mysql/blob/master/manifests/server/root_password.pp

Change-Id: I5bb1c23f5fbe7e6fd28537aef4fbfc1be5950dcc

commit_message:
Update variable loading pattern from the skeleton

The newer version of the distribution specific variable pattern allows
us to minimize the numeber of configuration files in which we need
to record specific variables by implementing overlay loading.

Also this avoid the previous bug caused by the fact that `RedHat` is
also an ansible_os_family but also an ansible_distribution.

The new pattern explicitely looks for `family-` prefix for families.

This template also adds few empty configuration files which should make
it easier for the developer to identify where he should define the vars.

Change-Id: Ica335be97eacc560bbadf180862d70f55442ae8c

commit_message:
WIP: Make tox work on openstack-ansible-tests

By default tox will not work on on a cloned copy of
apenstack-ansible-tests because all paths inside its commands reffer to
tests/common folder which does not exists.

We fix the issue by creating a symlink that maps tests/common to
repository.

This should allow use to run tox on this repository without affecting
other roles that are using it.

Running commands because tox is possible via tox-run-before, so we
do not to invent new ways of running the tests.

From now on users should be able to just call tox directly as runtests.sh
would be called by tox.

To keep backwards compatibility, running run_tests.sh still works as before.

Change-Id: Id1d4d1f2825d7bec2e1ee52e03110d8797b131e5

commit_message:
Raise hacking to 2.x

We have kept hacking capped below 1.2 for quite awhile. Newer versions
of hacking pull in updated linters that have some good checks.

We want to limit the maximum version of hacking installed since the
global upper constraints does not do this for linters. Otherwise when a
new release of hacking is available in the future, stable branches may
suddenly be broken.

Change-Id: I0e0ee8a169ae93f7efb2cda2b1d2458c1d49e46b
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Install proper heatclient for py2 and py3

Currently pip is pulling python-heatclient==2.0.0 on py27
environment which does not work py27 leading to failure in
quickstart.sh install_deps step. Making the version different
for py2 and py3 fixes the issue.

Closes-Bug: #1869161

Change-Id: I9a81d6f555fb0cfdbafffa5f696807df7b29364f
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 20172, 'name': 'Michele Baldessari', 'email': 'michele@acksyn.org', 'username': 'michele'}, {'_account_id': 20778, 'name': 'Damien Ciabrini', 'email': 'dciabrin@redhat.com', 'username': 'dciabrin'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-29 14:34:29.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/params.pp'], 'message': 'Fix os version test

On RHEL7 we see:
Error: Could not find resource 'Service[pcsd]' for relationship from 'File[etc-pacemaker-authkey]' on node overcloud-controller-2.localdomain

I think a small typo slipped into: 56a11120019d "Update os variables"

 if (versioncmp($::os['release']['major'], '7.0') < 0) {

should be

 if (versioncmp($::os['release']['full'], '7.0') < 0) {

Otherwise the first if is always true and we end up with pcsd_mode =
false which is why we get the error 'Error: Could not find resource
'Service[pcsd]' for relationship from 'File[etc-pacemaker-authkey]'

Tested this and I correctly get past the errors on rhel7.

Change-Id: I7e7f6bc378b3c0f3f3f6e286a09bc8339d3ce70e
Closes-Bug: #1869586
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix os version test

On RHEL7 we see:
Error: Could not find resource 'Service[pcsd]' for relationship from 'File[etc-pacemaker-authkey]' on node overcloud-controller-2.localdomain

I think a small typo slipped into: 56a11120019d "Update os variables"

 if (versioncmp($::os['release']['major'], '7.0') < 0) {

should be

 if (versioncmp($::os['release']['full'], '7.0') < 0) {

Otherwise the first if is always true and we end up with pcsd_mode =
false which is why we get the error 'Error: Could not find resource
'Service[pcsd]' for relationship from 'File[etc-pacemaker-authkey]'

Tested this and I correctly get past the errors on rhel7.

Change-Id: I7e7f6bc378b3c0f3f3f6e286a09bc8339d3ce70e
Closes-Bug: #1869586

subject: Install swift and cinder client from pip if needed
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-29 18:58:41.000000000', 'files': ['lib/cinder', 'lib/swift'], 'message': "Install swift and cinder client from pip if needed

We have logic to install swiftclient if swift is enabled because
glance uses swift by default if it's enabled. However, if swiftclient
isn't in the list of libs to install from source, we no-op. This was
fine when we were accidentally getting python-swiftclient from
the test-requirements of glance-store, but it's an actual need, so
we need to also fall back to installing from pip. Same story
with cinderclient which is also pulled in originally from glance_store
test-requirements.

Change-Id: I658d190557a993f3cfe6ed55e5d2159f47f7d35e
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Install swift and cinder client from pip if needed

We have logic to install swiftclient if swift is enabled because
glance uses swift by default if it's enabled. However, if swiftclient
isn't in the list of libs to install from source, we no-op. This was
fine when we were accidentally getting python-swiftclient from
the test-requirements of glance-store, but it's an actual need, so
we need to also fall back to installing from pip. Same story
with cinderclient which is also pulled in originally from glance_store
test-requirements.

Change-Id: I658d190557a993f3cfe6ed55e5d2159f47f7d35e

commit_message:
Cleanup old cruft

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Update requirements: Remove sphinx, it's not needed for testing, add
  pygments which is really needed.
- Update doc/requirements: Remove python 2.7 support
- tox.ini: Remove testing of po files, the infra scripts do this since
  a long time
- Update conf.py, no need to import openstackdocstheme anymore.

Change-Id: I9d030eb450f2c7ae74c25b7564a01b8785503e5e

commit_message:

', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2019-09-23 21:26:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "if wholedisk set boot dev to disk

We changed the default behavior to attempt to walk thorugh and still
setup a network booting environment if we are using a whole disk image
at some point long ago. This was not really a great idea because we are
not actually evaluating the contents of the disk to achieve the desired
end state which is always to boot an instance.

That being said, disks imagle should always have boot loaders, and we
should always thus setup boot from local disk as opposed to set PXE.

NOTE(TheJulia): I'm away and unable to revise this patch. Pleaes feel
free to edit/amend as long as the overall theme is maintained.

Change-Id: I6cdbf137c62ae02a7dc3f8d048a290aac48e6103

setup a network booting environment if we are using a whole disk image
at some point long ago. This was not really a great idea because we are
not actually evaluating the contents of the disk to achieve the desired
end state which is always to boot an instance.

That being said, disks imagle should always have boot loaders, and we
should always thus setup boot from local disk as opposed to set PXE.

NOTE(TheJulia): I'm away and unable to revise this patch. Pleaes feel
free to edit/amend as long as the overall theme is maintained.

setup a network booting environment if we are using a whole disk image

end state which is always to boot an instance.

That being said, disks imagle should always have boot loaders, and we

end state which is always to boot an instance.

That being said, disks imagle should always have boot loaders, and we
should always thus setup boot from local disk as opposed to set PXE.

free to edit/amend as long as the overall theme is maintained.

commit_message:
if wholedisk set boot dev to disk

We changed the default behavior to attempt to walk thorugh and still
setup a network booting environment if we are using a whole disk image
at some point long ago. This was not really a great idea because we are
not actually evaluating the contents of the disk to achieve the desired
end state which is always to boot an instance.

That being said, disks imagle should always have boot loaders, and we
should always thus setup boot from local disk as opposed to set PXE.

*** This change makes sense for something backportable, but
since the default boot mode has been changed in master branch
it may no longer make sense to proceed with.

Change-Id: I6cdbf137c62ae02a7dc3f8d048a290aac48e6103

subject: Replace assertItemsEqual with assertCountEqual
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-29 15:03:14.000000000', 'files': ['translator/tests/test_translate_node_template.py'], 'message': "Replace assertItemsEqual with assertCountEqual

assertItemsEqual was removed from Python's unittest.TestCase in
Python 3.3 [1][2]. We have been able to use them since then, because
testtools required unittest2, which still included it. With testtools
removing Python 2.7 support [3][4], we will lose support for
assertItemsEqual, so we should switch to use assertCountEqual.

[1] - https://bugs.python.org/issue17866
[2] - https://hg.python.org/cpython/rev/d9921cb6e3cd
[3] - https://github.com/testing-cabal/testtools/issues/286
[4] - https://github.com/testing-cabal/testtools/pull/277

Change-Id: I53f758e7e8870b43b675f4c63d986f07d199c259
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Replace assertItemsEqual with assertCountEqual

assertItemsEqual was removed from Python's unittest.TestCase in
Python 3.3 [1][2]. We have been able to use them since then, because
testtools required unittest2, which still included it. With testtools
removing Python 2.7 support [3][4], we will lose support for
assertItemsEqual, so we should switch to use assertCountEqual.

[1] - https://bugs.python.org/issue17866
[2] - https://hg.python.org/cpython/rev/d9921cb6e3cd
[3] - https://github.com/testing-cabal/testtools/issues/286
[4] - https://github.com/testing-cabal/testtools/pull/277

Change-Id: I53f758e7e8870b43b675f4c63d986f07d199c259

commit_message:
Fix GPT partition tables after agent writes contents

Fixes errors that were being raised upon restarting the agent
directly written out software raid images as the raidset is
restarted for device consistency and partition updates later
on in the code path of deployment.

Story: 2007455
Task: 39187
Change-Id: I9abf51eb77b262932e70329af5ce1593106a3171

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-15 00:43:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'WIP: Expose instance action event details out of the API

todo: api samples tests, negative unit tests

This adds a new microversion to expose the instance action
event details in the
GET /servers/{server_id}/os-instance-actions/{request_id} API.

With the new microversion the "details" key is always returned
with each event dict but the value may be null because of old
records or events that did not fail.

The details are not constrained by policy like the traceback
field since the details are like a fault message on the server
resource when the server is in ERROR status and the fault
message is likewise not constraint by policy unlike the fault
details which is a traceback like the event traceback field.

Implements blueprint action-event-fault-details

Change-Id: I6fe4dd265b0030ce12f92771b255a3d795f03d01

commit_message:
Expose instance action event details out of the API

This adds a new microversion to expose the instance action
event details in the
GET /servers/{server_id}/os-instance-actions/{request_id} API.

With the new microversion the "details" key is always returned
with each event dict but the value may be null because of old
records or events that did not fail.

The details are not constrained by policy like the traceback
field since the details are like a fault message on the server
resource when the server is in ERROR status and the fault
message is likewise not constraint by policy unlike the fault
details which is a traceback like the event traceback field.

This commit add a SYSTEM_READER ('rule: system_reader_api') role
to the Show Server Action Details API. With this default policy,
events fault details can be displayed. And also add some nova and
non-nova exception functional tests for os-instance-actions API.

Co-Authored-By: Brin Zhang <zhangbailin@inspur.com>

Implements blueprint action-event-fault-details
Change-Id: I6fe4dd265b0030ce12f92771b255a3d795f03d01

commit_message:
Refactor Zaqar to satisfy openstack uwsgi goal

After this change, Zaqar-wsgi will not be forced to port 8888 by
devstack. Use apache proxy now and the endpoint will be like:
http://IP/messaging by default.

Change-Id: I413cd24a9ef70a8bbada46d63d5dfdff09366b3e

commit_message:
Support allowed_cidrs for Octavia listener

Support ``allowed_cidrs`` property for the resource ``OS::Octavia::Listener``,
the property is allowed to be updated as well. The property 'allowed_cidrs'
was introduced in Octavia since Train release. The default value is empty
list if it is not specified in Heat template.

Task: 38952
Story: 2007378

Change-Id: I9d38716b236b0782f0d09097b7a0f615fe5be041

commit_message:
Retry agent get_command_status upon failures

The agent command status code lacks any retry mechanism
which meant if any intermittent failure such as a dropped
packet or an overloaded firewall could potentially begin
to cause the entire deployment or cleaning process to derail
and fail.

This fix addes logic to ensure we retry upon such failures.

Worth noting, the exact same logic has been used elsewhere
in the agent client code for the exact same problem when
issuing commands.

Change-Id: I4f6581b7fb895ed2b1d505b9947e363665551b57
Story: 2007470
Task: 39158
(cherry picked from commit 242775ae184582ce51a006e5797e7017133617f3)

commit_message:
Exit overcloud-deploy.sh on provision failure

This script file does not have 'set -e' due to the exit handling of
other commands in this script, so provision failures do not stop the
overcloud deploy from happening.

This change will exit this script if provision does not succeed.

Change-Id: I76edf84d206ee1601dccb39c8380f0bdd575173e

commit_message:
Added missing {user, project}_domain_name in Api

In examples/connect.py, openstack.connect api call requires
user_domain_name and project_domain_name as a required args
which was missing lead to api failure while connecting to
openstack cloud.

It fixes the same.

Story: 2006281
Task: 35984

Change-Id: I79d977282f4bc7699957a0275d251b75c2642cc2
Signed-off-by: Amol Kahat <amolkahat@gmail.com>

subject: fcos: Mount /:/rootfs:ro to Kubelet
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-28 21:59:06.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/drivers/common/templates/kubernetes/fragments/configure-kubernetes-minion.sh', 'magnum/drivers/common/templates/kubernetes/fragments/configure-kubernetes-master.sh'], 'message': 'fcos: Mount /:/rootfs:ro to Kubelet

Kubelet fails to handle SELinux labelling of Cinder PV without
presenting the rootfs to Kubelet and as a result, an unprivileged
container lacks the ability to access the path.

With this patch, Kubelet handles the correct labelling automatically
when a Cinder PV is attached to a pod.

The default behaviour using system containers in Fedora Atomic is to
mount rootfs [1] but we did not implement the same behaviour in Fedora
CoreOS which was a mistake as this was a missing piece of code.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/magnum/blob/master/dockerfiles/kubernetes-kubelet/config.json.template#L335

Story: 2007413
Task: 39129

Change-Id: Id59c604928244bf49773b7519fa756d5b2814b69
(cherry picked from commit 1994e9448a4d131e6305b68e49f1fdcdb5420cef)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
fcos: Mount /:/rootfs:ro to Kubelet

Kubelet fails to handle SELinux labelling of Cinder PV without
presenting the rootfs to Kubelet and as a result, an unprivileged
container lacks the ability to access the path.

With this patch, Kubelet handles the correct labelling automatically
when a Cinder PV is attached to a pod.

The default behaviour using system containers in Fedora Atomic is to
mount rootfs [1] but we did not implement the same behaviour in Fedora
CoreOS which was a mistake as this was a missing piece of code.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/magnum/blob/master/dockerfiles/kubernetes-kubelet/config.json.template#L335

Story: 2007413
Task: 39129

Change-Id: Id59c604928244bf49773b7519fa756d5b2814b69
(cherry picked from commit 1994e9448a4d131e6305b68e49f1fdcdb5420cef)

commit_message:
[ceph-daemons] Redirect all the logs to stdout

This is to redirect all the logs from daemons to stdout to avoid
accumulating large sized log files on filesystem.

NOTE: The ceph-osd daemon won't work this way and is addressed
separately in https://review.opendev.org/715295. All other Ceph
daemons are included here.

Change-Id: I3045d6e941791aba14979472fac1bca09776d3bf

commit_message:
Ceph-OSD: Add log tailer to ceph-osd

This change adds in a log tailer script in a pod that tails the ceph
logs, periodicly truncating them.

Change-Id: Idbe03d4123f86b1b88e277fea6d13f58104f94b0
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

commit_message:
If only .pyc exist, the extension API will be disabled

In some commercial production environments, generally will not expose the
source code, this means that only .pyc files exist in the environment.In
this case, the extension API cannot be loaded.

Closes-Bug:#1869148
Change-Id: Id5238e7efe5ff0b80197ac0afa9f5f7a73239f20
(cherry picked from commit 8c582d87912270afa37371bbb202ae98dc1d375c)
(cherry picked from commit 6b3daf4814cac704a4a112a559f3e36121a0e532)

subject: Change default listening address for health checks.
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-27 09:59:41.000000000', 'files': ['kuryr_kubernetes/controller/managers/health.py', 'kuryr_kubernetes/cni/health.py'], 'message': 'Change default listening address for health checks.

Currently, regardless of the version of the IP protocol used, health
check services for kuryr CNI and kuryr controller, are always listen on
0.0.0.0, which effectively means any interface. In this patch we propose
to chang that to include IPv6 address as well.

Change-Id: I96fc1033b93bd54b70c7caaa428076baf73b4207
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Change default listening address for health checks.

Currently, regardless of the version of the IP protocol used, health
check services for kuryr CNI and kuryr controller, are always listen on
0.0.0.0, which effectively means any interface. In this patch we propose
to chang that to include IPv6 address as well.

Change-Id: I96fc1033b93bd54b70c7caaa428076baf73b4207

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Updates for python 2.7 drop

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Only update required is in tox to define common baspython as py3 os that
all tox env including [testenv:functional] will use py3 instead of py2.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: Iaa968bccc27575ab81b05066cfb8d34817cdf249

commit_message:
Prepare Server to be used in cloud layer

One step to use server resource in the cloud layer. Expansion stuff is 
added. It is intended to return plain server Serource without 
normalization, for that it receives all the stuff we currently add in 
the cloud layer. After this is merged the finalization of cloud._compute 
will be a bit smaller.

Change-Id: I6fbdb25610dba69b95df8f09a39fd6606866561d

commit_message:
Allow setting volume attach status

This feature was available in the Cinder client however it does
not exist in OpenStack client.

This patch adds the ability to use `--attach-status` to reset the
attach status of a volume using the Cinder API.

Change-Id: I2631e326a0e693deccfc95df149115442765bf3d
Closes-Bug: #1745699

os-traits: release 2.3.0

  - setup.cfg: Configure 'python-requires' [4]

commit_message:
Update master for stable/train

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/train.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/train.

Change-Id: I7c7796c3da01af546d3631d1bfc398b7d7d933fb
Sem-Ver: feature

subject: Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-26 17:54:19.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I510fbc4ee923cee005826cf81220f9e6e0549c9d
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I510fbc4ee923cee005826cf81220f9e6e0549c9d

commit_message:
[tests] Improve devstack/post playbook efficiency

By adjusting the syntax to the newer format, the fetch-subunit
role will be skipped entirely, rather than run with all its
tasks skipped. This gives us results sooner and burns less
electricity, making the world a better place. :)

Change-Id: I6ae5a63051d512eecb2a603af9d74ec139eb0877
(cherry picked from commit 6535d6eafa651a526451a3bd31215be8c44115a7)

commit_message:
Run fetch-subunit-output role conditionally

Jobs that inherit from base job don't always run unit tests or
use subunit. This post playbook will fail for them, so make subinit
role optional and set by default for true.
For example disable it for ansible collection functional jobs:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/711471/
Change-Id: I50b1020c896d7d8a7d58e62de778bb8c2b6e970e
(cherry picked from commit 994c97e0bfbc1ac693e54ff14d4121f68c620b0d)

commit_message:
Added new project openstack-tempest-skiplist

It creates the openstack-tempest-skiplist and import existing
skiplist from openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras project to
openstack-tempest-skiplist.

It is a collection of skipped tempest tests which is initially
started by TripleO team and will be shared with OSA and other
projects.

Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/714030

Change-Id: Id9648164023590a440c56906ecd982523b176179
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
[WIP] ceph-mon: Add log tailer to ceph-mon

This change adds in a log tailer script in a pod that tails the ceph
logs, periodicly truncating them.

commit_message:
Remove mysql dependency

The module does only rely on the mysql
module implictly through the openstacklib
module which means its not a direct dependency.

This value is always outdated since we bumped
the dependency in [1]. This probably needs to
be fixed in other modules as well.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/710523/

Change-Id: Ic6d4794e7960059d70534c1cbcc12f4e933ad1a4

commit_message:
Add show_image_direct_url when glance_backend_ceph is true

When use ceph as the backend storage of glance, the
'show_image_direct_url' must be set to True when
would like to use copy-on-write in the ceph offical
documents

Change-Id: Ide644ebc1917b8f9931e48c77c7808ba62a36d7c

', 'number': 13}, {'created': '2019-06-24 20:30:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "[WIP] Move to 'OnDelete' upgrade strategy for ceph-osd daemonsets

- This is to move upgrade strategy for ceph-osd ds to 'OnDelete'

- Check for backfill/recover between  osd restarts so that performance of
  the ceph cluster will not be degraded .

- Helm post upgrade  hook to trigger an orchestrator which will delete the
  osd pods intelligently by considering pg backfill/recover status.

- Reliable ceph-osd upgrades since we are checking ceph cluster between pod
  restarts.

Co-Authored-By: Stephen Taylor <st053q@att.com>

Change-Id: I21e1bd6796991b26f2f8eefe608d0cefd2356e60

commit_message:
[wip]Ceph-OSD: Move to 'OnDelete' upgrade strategy for ceph-osd daemonsets

- Move upgrade strategy for ceph-osd ds to 'OnDelete'

- Helm post upgrade  hook to trigger an orchestrator which will delete the
  osd pods intelligently by considering pg  status.

- Reliable ceph-osd upgrades since we are checking for pg status before picking
  osd for restarts.

Co-Authored-By: Stephen Taylor <st053q@att.com>

Change-Id: I21e1bd6796991b26f2f8eefe608d0cefd2356e60

commit_message:
[ceph-osd] Create rack based daemonset and configmap

This is to extend the host override functionaity to create rack based
daemonset along with list of nodes belongs to that rack sothat single
ds will spawn the pods on rack.

This will be helpful when we enable rack based failure domians since
upgrades will first bring down the pods belongs to respective racks.

Change-Id: I92f37fa169322894185325e69153dc20da1b17a1

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-20 15:36:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'RBD: fix volume reference handling in clone logic

This patch fixes a bug in volume cloning where the source volume is
prematurely closed.  If the destination volume requires flattening and
an exception occurs during flattening, the code attempts to perform
cleanup operations on an already closed volume.  This resulted in a
segmentation fault which causes cinder to restart.

Co-authored-by: Jon Bernard <jobernar@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ib713aa91b775d8ec07ffdb24dfe1db1b6ecf2921
Closes-Bug: #1794956
(cherry picked from commit 394fbd7e20dbd8fb8cc58510657753432c43fa9b)

commit_message:
RBD: fix volume reference handling in clone logic

This patch fixes a bug in volume cloning where the source volume is
prematurely closed.  If the destination volume requires flattening and
an exception occurs during flattening, the code attempts to perform
cleanup operations on an already closed volume.  This resulted in a
segmentation fault which causes cinder to restart.

Co-authored-by: Jon Bernard <jobernar@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ib713aa91b775d8ec07ffdb24dfe1db1b6ecf2921
Closes-Bug: #1794956
(cherry picked from commit 394fbd7e20dbd8fb8cc58510657753432c43fa9b)

The last Pygments release to support python 2 is 2.5.2, so our
python 2 tests are failing running the latest version 2.6.1.

commit_message:
Deprecate legacy way to retrieve neutron usage

neutron 'quota_details' extension was added in Pike to provide
a convenient way to retrieve resource usage in neutron without listing
individual resources. It was added in Pike release and we will have
six releases since then once Ussuri release is shipped. Enough time has
passed to migrate it to the new mechanism, so it is time to deprecate
the legacy way for future cleanup.

Change-Id: Ie0b4613bf9fdcd96481b3bb1139b4fb153bfef83

commit_message:
Have middlewarearchitecture doc reference auth_type option

We literally say in (the rendered version of) the same doc:

 # Authentication type to load (string value)
 # Deprecated group/name - [keystone_authtoken]/auth_plugin
 #auth_type = <None>

Looks like auth_plugin has been deprecated for quite some time:
https://opendev.org/openstack/keystoneauth/commit/a56ed4218

Change-Id: I2dafa0cb28f017667497e0a6585d96a8cd090d5f

commit_message:
Cleanup Python 2.7 support

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove section from setup.cfg: Wheel is not needed for python
  3 only repo
- Update requirements

Change-Id: Ibca03f9ebaeaca595e027be9cb5900c368c8de6d

subject: fcos: Mount /:/rootfs:ro to Kubelet
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-23 11:32:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'fcos: Mount /:/rootfs:ro to Kubelet

Kubelet fails to handle SELinux labelling of Cinder PV without
presenting the /rootfs to Kubelet and as a result, an unprivileged
container lacks the ability to access the path.

With this patch, Kubelet handles the correct labelling automatically
when a Cinder PV is attached to a pod.

PS: The default behaviour in Fedora Atomic was to mount the rootfs [1]
but we dropped it for some reason in Fedora CoreOS. However, it seems
like we really need it.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/magnum/blob/master/dockerfiles/kubernetes-kubelet/config.json.template#L335

Story: 2007413
Task: 39129

Change-Id: Id59c604928244bf49773b7519fa756d5b2814b69
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2020-03-27 10:54:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'fcos: Mount /:/rootfs:ro to Kubelet

commit_message:
fcos: Mount /:/rootfs:ro to Kubelet

Kubelet fails to handle SELinux labelling of Cinder PV without
presenting the rootfs to Kubelet and as a result, an unprivileged
container lacks the ability to access the path.

With this patch, Kubelet handles the correct labelling automatically
when a Cinder PV is attached to a pod.

The default behaviour using system containers in Fedora Atomic is to
mount rootfs [1] but we did not implement the same behaviour in Fedora
CoreOS which was a mistake as this was a missing piece of code.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/magnum/blob/master/dockerfiles/kubernetes-kubelet/config.json.template#L335

Story: 2007413
Task: 39129

Change-Id: Id59c604928244bf49773b7519fa756d5b2814b69

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-25 21:36:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add 'DNS' check during SSHClient init

In TripleO deployments the Undercloud does not have the hostname entries
to do a proper DNS resolution of its associated compute nodes. Since the
return value from get_all_hypervisors() is dynamic based on the
deployment, either hypervisor hostname or control plane address, this
has the potential to cause problems. One problem would be attempting to
force a server to be scheduled to a specific hypervisor. Since the
server creation api requires the hypervisor hostname/internal ip
address, not the compute nodeâs control plane IP address, extra steps
would have to be taken in a TripleO environment to provide the correct
hostname. There have also been problems where a hostname is the only
parameter passed to the SSHClient which results in a failure to
establish a connection, Commit  #c0fe4394c0 is an example of this being
addressed. This commit attempts to make the get_all_hypervisors() call
be consistent across deployments and only return hypervisor hostname.

BaseWhiteboxComputeTest.get_all_hypervisors() has been changed to
get_all_hypervisor_hostnames(). For Devstack deployments its
functionality remains the same, but for TripleO deployments it will now
return hypervisor hostnames instead of the control plane addresses. A
new method was added to BaseWhiteboxComputeTest as well,
get_hypervisor_hostname() which performs the same functionality as
get_hypervisor_ip(), but returns the hostname instead of the control
plane IP address of the compute node.

clients.SSHClient has been updated to do a âDNSâ check on the provided
control_plane address during initialization. This is done through static
method _attempt_tempest_dns_lookup(). If the control_plane_address is
already a valid IP address or if it is a DevStack deployment no action
is necessary and will set the control_plane_address of the object to the
provided value. If it is a TripleO deployment, it attempts to translate
the control_plane_adress hostname value to itâs IP address and use that
for the SSHClient object instead.

NUMALiveMigrationTest.test_cpu_pinning and
VolumesAdminNegativeTest.test_detach_failure were both updated to use
these new methods when applicable. And test_base.py was updated to test
get_all_hypervisor_hostnames() instead of get_all_hypervisors().

", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2020-03-25 23:25:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add 'DNS' check during SSHClient init

In TripleO deployments the Undercloud does not have the hostname entries
to do a proper DNS resolution of its associated compute nodes. Since the
return value from get_all_hypervisors() is dynamic based on the
deployment, either hypervisor hostname or control plane address, this
has the potential to cause problems. One problem would be attempting to
force a server to be scheduled to a specific hypervisor. Since the
server creation api requires the hypervisor hostname/internal ip
address, not the compute nodeâs control plane IP address, extra steps
would have to be taken in a TripleO environment to provide the correct
hostname. There have also been problems where a hostname is the only
parameter passed to the SSHClient which results in a failure to
establish a connection, Commit  #c0fe4394c0 is an example of this being
addressed. This commit attempts to make the get_all_hypervisors() call
be consistent across deployments and only return hypervisor hostname.

BaseWhiteboxComputeTest.get_all_hypervisors() has been changed to
get_all_hypervisor_hostnames(). For Devstack deployments its
functionality remains the same, but for TripleO deployments it will now
return hypervisor hostnames instead of the control plane addresses. A
new method was added to BaseWhiteboxComputeTest as well,
get_hypervisor_hostname() which performs the same functionality as
get_hypervisor_ip(), but returns the hostname instead of the control
plane IP address of the compute node.

clients.SSHClient has been updated to do a âDNSâ check on the provided
control_plane address during initialization. This is done through static
method _attempt_tempest_dns_lookup(). If the control_plane_address is
already a valid IP address or if it is a DevStack deployment no action
is necessary and will set the control_plane_address of the object to the
provided value. If it is a TripleO deployment, it attempts to translate
the control_plane_adress hostname value to itâs IP address and use that
for the SSHClient object instead.

NUMALiveMigrationTest.test_cpu_pinning and
VolumesAdminNegativeTest.test_detach_failure were both updated to use
these new methods when applicable. And test_base.py was updated to test
get_all_hypervisor_hostnames() instead of get_all_hypervisors().
